subject: CLSP
title: Orientation
info: Orientation to medical technology (clinical laboratory science) profession.
prereqInfo: prereq: Interest in field of Clinical Laboratory Sciences

subject: CLSP
title: Specialty Rotation
info: One-week clinical rotation in specialty lab such as immunophenotyping, cytogenetics, surgical pathology, molecular diagnostics, immunology, or forensics.

subject: CLSP
title: Honors
info: Individual assignment to special projects or research in one of the clinical areas of chemistry, hematology, immunohematology, or microbiology.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Diagnostic Microbiology II
info: Overview of lab-aided diagnosis of bacterial, mycobacterial, viral, fungal, parasitic infectious diseases.
prereqInfo: prereq: One microbiology course with lab, one biochem course, enrolled year 4 CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Diagnostic Microbiology Lectur
info: Techniques used in laboratory diagnosis of infectious disease.  Isolating/identifying bacteria/yeast. Antibacterial susceptibility testing. Lecture.
prereqInfo: prereq: One microbiology course with lab, one biochem course, enrolled year 4 CLS student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Diagnostic Microbiology Lab
info: Techniques used in lab diagnosis of infectious disease. Isolating/identifying bacteria/yeasts. Antimicrobial susceptibility testing. Lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: One microbiology course with lab, one biochem course, enrolled CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Hematology I
info: Theory/application of basic principles in clinical hematology.  Lecture, lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: Enrolled year 4 CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Hemat ology II
info: Fundamentals of examining blood/bone marrow. Emphasizes identification of normal, immature, abnormal cells. Correlation of clinical/lab findings. Lecture, lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: [4201 or 5201], enrolled year 4 CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Hemostasis
info: Theory/application of concepts/techniques in hemostasis/coagulation. Lecture, Lab. Online course.
prereqInfo: prereq: [4201 or 5201], enrolled year 4 CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Compar Hemostasis
info: Theory and application of specific concepts and techniques in hemostasis and coagulation.

subject: CLSP
title: Urinalysis
info: Procedures for physical, chemical, microscopic examination of urine. Lecture, lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: Enrolled year 4 CLSP student

subject: CLSP
title: Clinical Chemistry I
info: Assessing renal/metabolic disease/dysfunction, electrolyte, and acid-base balance. Principles/processes for quality management in clinical lab. Lecture online only, lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: Two organic chem courses with lab, one biochem course, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Clinical Chemistry II
info: Principles/application of clinical chemistry. Correlation of clinical/lab findings.
prereqInfo: prereq: [4302 or 5302], two organic chem courses with lab, one biochem course, year 4 CLSP student.

subject: CLSP
title: Clinical Chemistry II: Lab
info: Principles/application of lab procedures in clinical chemistry.
prereqInfo: prereq: [4302 or 5302], two organic chem courses with lab, one biochem course

subject: CLSP
title: Clin Chem I: Lab
info: Application of clinical chemistry principles and lab techniques in the analysis of urine, plasma, and body fluids.  Emphasis on lab tests to evaluate renal function, electrolytes, and acid-base balance.  Principles and processes for managing test quality.

subject: CLSP
title: Immunology
info: Basic principles of human immune function, clinical applications, clinical techniques (including flow cytometry).
prereqInfo: prereq: BIOC 3021, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Molecular Diagnostics
info: Theory/application of molecular diagnostics in clinical lab.  Lecture, lab.

subject: CLSP
title: Intro Transfusion Medicine
info: Principles of blood grouping, antibody identification, compatibility testing, donor testing for transfusion medicine.

subject: CLSP
title: Transfusion Med Laboratory
info: Exercises illustrating basic techniques in blood grouping, antibody identification, compatibility testing, donor testing for transfusion medicine.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4401 or 5401

subject: CLSP
title: Mgmt & Prof Issues
info: Basic concepts in professional issues and management as applied to clinical lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4602, CLSP student

subject: CLSP
title: Education and Research
info: Basic concepts in education/research as applied to clinical laboratory.
prereqInfo: prereq: instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: App Diagn Micro
info: Isolation, identification, and antimicrobial susceptibility testing of clinically significant microbes from patient specimens.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4102, 4101 enrolled CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Appl Clin Heme/Hemostasis
info: Application of basic methods/techniques in clinical hematology, cellular morphology, and hemostasis.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4201, 4202, 4203, enrolled CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: App Clin Chem/UA
info: Application of basic methods/techniques in clinical chemistry lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4301, 4302, 4304, 4305, enrolled CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: App Transfusion Medicine
info: Application of basic methods/techniques in tranfusion medicine lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: 4501, 4502, enrolled CLSP student, instr consent

subject: CLSP
title: Specialty Rotation
info: A one week rotation in specialty lab such as cytogenetics, flow cytometry, microbiology lab at MN Dept of Health, and other choices.

subject: CLSP
title: Spec Lab Methods
info: Individual assignment to special project in research lab or clinical lab.
prereqInfo: prereq: CLSP student, instr consent
